com.tsp.models

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.Vector<Domino<?>>
          • com.tsp.models.Hand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Domino<?>>, java.util.Collection<Domino<?>>, java.util.List<Domino<?>>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class Hand
extends java.util.Vector<Domino<?>>
    This class contains seven methods (chooseDomino(), chooseDominoWithoutRemoving(), canPutItOnTable(), getDomino(), show(), removeFromHand() and drawFromStock()), setters and getters for the attributes.
    Since:
    10/05/2015
    Version:
    3.0.0

      • Hand

        public Hand(Stock stock)

    • Method Detail

      • chooseDomino

        public Domino<?> chooseDomino(int left,
                     int right)
        This function chooses the domino to play from the player's hand if he has any corresponding and removes it from the hand.
        Parameters:
        left - The left value of the domino
        right - The right value of the domino
        Returns:
        Domino chosen from the hand

      • chooseDominoWithoutRemoving

        public Domino<?> chooseDominoWithoutRemoving(int left,
                                    int right)
        This function chooses the domino to play from the player's hand if he has any corresponding without removing it from the hand.
        Parameters:
        left - The left value of the domino
        right - The right value of the domino
        Returns:
        Domino chosen from the hand

      • canPutItOnTable

        public boolean canPutItOnTable(Domino<java.lang.Integer> d,
                      int extLeftValue,
                      int extRightValue)
        This function checks if the player can play/put a chosen domino on the table according to the current extreme table values.
        Parameters:
        d - The chosen domino
        extLeftValue - The left extreme value of the table
        extRightValue - The right extreme value of the table
        Returns:
        True (if the player can put a specific domino) or False (if not)

      • getDomino

        public Domino getDomino(int v1,
               int v2)
        This function checks if the domino with the value v1 and v2 exists get it and remove it from the user's hand.
        Parameters:
        v1 - The left value of the domino
        v2 - The right value of the domino
        Returns:
        The domino if it exists or null otherwise

      • show

        public void show()
        This method is used to display on the standard output (console) the player's hand value(s).

      • removeFromHand

        public void removeFromHand(Domino d)
        This function removes a specific domino from the player's hand.
        Parameters:
        d - The domino to remove

      • drawFromStock

        public Domino drawFromStock()
        This function checks if the stock still contains dominos. If so, it will draw from it and put in the player's hand.
        Returns:
        The domino drawn from the stock
